data.title: Menu item 'Check For Updates' should be disabled when there's no frontmost window
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0
- OS Version: Mac OS X 10.11.4

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch VSCode
2. Close all windows
3. Go to menu 'Code' and select 'Check For Updates'
4. Nothing, no alert, no message.  Like the menu item was never selected.

data.title: Syntax highlighting after Installation lost
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0 
- OS Version: windows 10  rel:14342 (german)

No C# Syntax Highlighting and no IntelliSense  after VS Code Update to Version 1.1.0.0
Same Situation on 2 different Machines

data.title: Fix Korean translation
data.body:
In Korean, '찾기' means Find, not mac Finder.
I changed it to '파인더' that sounds 'Finder' in Korean.

data.title: The snippets for markdown is not valid.
data.body:
- VSCode Version : 1.1.0
- OS Version : Deepin 15.1.1

I can't use snippets with markdown.

data.title: Ubuntu vs code black screen on loading any file or project
data.body:
- VSCode Version:
- OS Version: ubuntu 14.04.4 LTS

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open vs code
2. Black screen on the vs code window

data.title: 安装插件时,在搜索或下载插件页面好慢.切换到另外窗口.就马上把安装插件界面给关了
data.body:
- VSCode Version:
- OS Version: windows 1.1

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Ctrl+p后.搜索某个插件
2. 比喻填上ext install crane 会进行等待差不多1分钟,才能显示出来插件列表.
   3,在这个等待过程中.界面不能失去焦点.不然就取消了插件的下载或安装.
   这个体验很不好.希望能在后台自动下载安装.可以最小化或切换到另外的程序或窗口.避免长时间等待...

data.title: Do not autoclose `'`
data.body: `'` is used to denote a lifetime, as in `fn foo<'a>(bar: &'a Baz) { ...` and it isn't helpful to have it automatically closed.

data.title: Please add Class Viewer

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Please add a Class Viewer for Typescript 
![classview](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11835025/15271523/2081d1cc-1a4f-11e6-8096-85b69a0667ad.jpg)
like QT Creator has for C++

data.title: Error: Extension host terminated when first started and on Reload Window
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0 (1.1.0)
- OS Version: OS X El Capitan 10.11.4

I tried this with different downloads, and it happens consistently: as the window opens the following error message shows in the top of the window:

Error: Extension host terminated unexpectedly. Please reload the window to recover.

Pressing Reload Window button causes main vscode window to go completely black and after the side bar and the status bar reappear the message is back.

I did try rm -rf ~/.vscode\* and restart and also when open and clicking "Reload Window" button and in both cases the message is back.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. downloaded latest vscode from website
2. double click vscode executable

See screenshot with error in Developer Tools

![untitled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2250424/15270923/253ceb20-19e6-11e6-97b5-b5108f2a5b60.png)

I tried also to delete .sock file and restart vscode but that did not help

```
srwxr-xr-x  1 lucnoc  staff  0 May 14 15:07 /var/folders/9c/gkt2df7j11b965s2c1tgxvk80000gn/T/Code-91fbfd.sock
```

data.title: Add a way to get removed text in TextDocumentChangeEvent
data.body:
Seems like there is no way to get the removed text in onDidChangeTextDocument as the document has already been changed at this point.

It would be nice to have eg. `oldText` in the TextDocumentContentChangeEvent.

data.title: DiagnosticsCollection#set doesn't merge by resource anymore
data.body:
As of the vscode 1.1 release, the `DiagnosticsCollection#set` API appears to only use the first item in the array of diagnostics provided to it when showing errors inside VS Code.

See https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-go/issues/322.

data.title: Git commit freezes UI
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0
- OS Version: Windows 7

Steps to Reproduce:
1. have files to commit
2. type your commit message
3. hit CTRL + enter (or whatever your shortcut is)
4. click on the more menu dots

Git goes on committing my code in my local repo, but the UI freezes. Closing the menu by clicking somewhere unfreezes VSCode.
When things are commited, you have options like push, etc. While commiting, these are grayed out. When Git is done, these stay grayed out. You have to reopen the menu to use these options.

![vscode_git_freeze](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13982006/15268998/58ec6864-19f1-11e6-86d2-3d29bae1a08e.gif)
Here I commit files white CTRL + enter and open the menu. The progress / loading bar stops and goes on after closing the menu.

data.title: [html] When using custom HTML tags, VS auto-align wrong way.
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.10.1 - OS Version: OS X 10.11.4 When using custom HTML tags, VS auto-align wrong way. Steps to Reproduce: 1. Type some words about tags. 2. Press "Tab" key and auto complete will complete. 3. Press "Tab" key again, and the close tag will complete. 4. In tag, press "Enter" key to create new line. But the close tag is not align. This happens on HTML custom tags, for tags like ``, it will be good.

data.title: Is there a method to enforced snippets?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: v1.1 - OS Version: windows10 In js , I may use some snippets about html. For example: html: ```
``` js: ``` var x=document.getElementById("bottonGroup"); x.append("");//In there, I want to use BootStrap snippets like "bs3-button-primary". //How can I do it? ``` In SublimText I can use ctrl+shift+P then input "bs3-button-primary". However , the VS Code is so beautiful that I don't want to use SublimText. So, I Hope you can improve the snippets about it. Thanks.

data.title: Debug Attach Timeout Error on Node Restart
data.body:
- VSCode Version:
  Version 1.1.0 (1.1.0)
- OS Version:
  OS X 10.11.4

Attached to the node debbugger OK, breakpoints etc all works fine.

Seems to always timeout after 3-4 seconds when I restart the node process (for an express app).

This always pops up after 3-4 seconds:

`Request 'evaluate' was cancelled because Node.js is unresponsive.`

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Start an express app: node --debug .

`Debugger listening on port 5858`
1.  Use this launch.json (default w/ added timeout)

```
{
            "name": "Attach",
            "type": "node",
            "request": "attach",
            "port": 5858,
            "address": "localhost",
            "restart": true,
      "timeout": 10000,
            "sourceMaps": false,
            "outDir": null,
            "localRoot": "${workspaceRoot}",
            "remoteRoot": null
        }
```

Then restart the node process .. error pops up in VSCode.

Please let me know if there's any more detail or explanation I can provide.

Thanks!

data.title: Allow multiple extensions to be installed/uninstalled through the CLI
data.body:
By the looks of the code this is partially implemented, not sure if it's just incomplete or a bug.

Expected syntax:

``` bash
code --install-extension ext1 ext2
```

data.title: Double clicking sidebar sash should optimize width of current sidebar, not just file explorer
data.body:
Currently double clicking the sash when the search sidebar is open looks like it attempts to optimize the width of the explorer. Additionally it gets it slightly off, probably because it's hidden and the explorer measurement algorithm assumed it would be visible.

/cc @mquandalle

data.title: Return 0 if extension already installed
--install-extension should return 0 when it's already installed
data.body:
Personally I would find it much easier to work with if it returns 0 if already installed (ie. mission already accomplished).

```
$ code --install-extension Tyriar.sort-lines
Extension 'Tyriar.sort-lines' is already installed.

$ echo $?
1
```

data.title: --install-extension should exit faster if already installed
data.body:
`--list-extensions` is much faster than `--install-extension` when it's already installed.

```
$ time code --list-extensions
...

real    0m0.173s
user    0m0.148s
sys 0m0.020s
```

vs

```
$ time code --install-extension Tyriar.sort-lines
Extension 'Tyriar.sort-lines' is already installed.

real    0m1.671s
user    0m0.240s
sys 0m0.012s
```

data.title: Alternate data streams are removed by saving

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.1.0
- OS Windows Pro 10.0.10586.318 V1511 

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open with VSCode a text file that has one or more alternate data stream files.
2. Make some small change in the text.
3. Save the file.
4. The ADS files have been removed.

I'm sure that there is a setting that will prevent VSCode removing ADS files when saving — they are, after all, a Windows special.  If not, could you please regard it as a bug and add such an option.

data.title: editor.insertSpaces setting ignored based on status bar setting
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0-alpha
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open settings
2. Add "editor.insertSpaces": false
3. Open a file and press tab

Spaces are still being inserted if your status bar setting is set to spaces.

data.title: Collapse all in Explorer change to expand all if collapsed
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0-alpha
- OS Version: Windows 10

Would it be possible to change the function of collapse all to expand all if all explorer items are already collapsed? Just a feature I thought could be useful.

data.title: Allow special characters like percent sign in snippet prefix
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

Creating snippets that start with % doesn't work.  E.g.

`"ACCOUNT": {
        "prefix": "%ACCOUNT",
        "body": [
            "%ACCOUNT ..."
        ]
    }`

I would expect to start typing "%ACCOUNT" and have VSCode suggest the snippet.

data.title: Option to hide the status bar
data.body: For those wishing to further minimize distractions and/or maximize screen space, an option to hide the status bar (the blue bar at the bottom) might be nice.

data.title: VSCode terminating without any error or warning when launching with keyboard shortcut key.
data.body: - VSCode Version:1.1.0-alpha - OS Version: Windows10 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Launch VS code 2. Open keybinding.json to add keyboard shortcut to launch developer tool as below: {"key": "CTRL+F12", "command": "workbench.action.toggleDevTools", "when": "editorTextFocus" } 3. Try to launch developer tool by pressing CTRL+F12. 4. Repeat step 3 multiple times and verify app behavior. Actual: Developer tool launching successfully but with few quick user's action to launch developer tool VScode is closing without any error or warning. Expected: Application should not be closed. ![keybindingissuewithdevtool](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/15261395/150ac4f0-1911-11e6-8de3-0429cc6a3d26.gif) Tried on MAC and getting below warning message:

data.title: debugging 'eval' not working on latest version
